title: Amber Riley
text:
Amber Patrice Riley (born February 15, 1986), sometimes known mononymously as RILEY, is an American actress, singer, author, and activist. She is best known for her portrayal of <a href="Mercedes%20Jones">Mercedes Jones</a> on the <a href="Fox%20Broadcasting%20Company">Fox</a> comedy-drama series "<a href="Glee%20%28TV%20series%29">Glee</a>" (2009–2015). For her performance on the series, she won a <a href="Screen%20Actors%20Guild%20Award">Screen Actors Guild Award</a>, and has been nominated for three <a href="Teen%20Choice%20Awards">Teen Choice Awards</a>, three <a href="NAACP%20Image%20Awards">NAACP Image Awards</a>, and a <a href="Grammy%20Award">Grammy Award</a>.
In 2016, Riley originated the lead role of <a href="Effie%20White">Effie White</a> in the <a href="West%20End%20theatre">West End</a> debut of "<a href="Dreamgirls">Dreamgirls</a>". She won the <a href="Laurence%20Olivier%20Award%20for%20Best%20Actress%20in%20a%20Musical">Laurence Olivier Award for Best Actress in a Musical</a> and <a href="Evening%20Standard%20Theatre%20Award%20for%20Best%20Musical%20Performance">Evening Standard Theatre Award for Best Musical Performance</a> in 2017 for her work.
Riley won <a href="Dancing%20with%20the%20Stars%20%28U.S.%20season%2017%29">season 17</a> of "<a href="Dancing%20with%20the%20Stars%20%28U.S.%20TV%20series%29">Dancing with the Stars</a>" in 2013. In 2017, Riley appeared as a judge on <a href="BBC%20One">BBC One</a> musical theatre talent show "<a href="Let%20It%20Shine%20%282017%20TV%20series%29">Let It Shine</a>" and formed a musical theatre <a href="Musical%20supergroup">supergroup</a> with <a href="Beverley%20Knight">Beverley Knight</a> and <a href="Cassidy%20Janson">Cassidy Janson</a>, known collectively as <a href="Leading%20Ladies%20%28group%29">Leading Ladies</a> and signed to <a href="East%20West%20Records">East West Records</a>/<a href="Warner%20Music%20Group">Warner</a>. Their debut album, "<a href="Songs%20from%20the%20Stage">Songs from the Stage</a>", was released on November 17, 2017.
Early life.
Riley was born in <a href="Los%20Angeles%20County">Los Angeles County</a>, <a href="California">California</a>, with a mother of the maiden name Hightower. She has two older sisters, Toiya and Ashley. Riley auditioned for "<a href="American%20Idol">American Idol</a>" when she was 17 years old, during the show's <a href="American%20Idol%20%28season%202%29">second season</a>, but was turned down by the producers. She graduated from <a href="La%20Mirada%20High%20School">La Mirada High School</a> in <a href="La%20Mirada%2C%20California">La Mirada, California</a> in 2004.
Career.
2009-2019: Breakthrough with "Glee" and other appearances.
In 2008, Riley was cast in the role of <a href="Mercedes%20Jones">Mercedes Jones</a> on the comedy-drama television series "<a href="Glee%20%28TV%20series%29">Glee</a>", and appeared as a main cast member for all but one of the six seasons—she received guest star credit during season 5. Riley performed numerous solos throughout the series' run, including "<a href="Respect%20%28song%29">Respect</a>", "<a href="Bust%20Your%20Windows">Bust Your Windows</a>", "<a href="Hate%20on%20Me">Hate on Me</a>", "<a href="And%20I%20Am%20Telling%20You%20I%27m%20Not%20Going">And I Am Telling You I'm Not Going</a>", "<a href="Beautiful%20%28Christina%20Aguilera%20song%29">Beautiful</a>", "<a href="Bridge%20over%20Troubled%20Water%20%28song%29">Bridge over Troubled Water</a>", "<a href="I%20Look%20to%20You">I Look to You</a>", "<a href="Ain%27t%20No%20Way">Ain't No Way</a>", "<a href="Try%20a%20Little%20Tenderness">Try a Little Tenderness</a>", "<a href="Spotlight%20%28Jennifer%20Hudson%20song%29">Spotlight</a>", "<a href="All%20I%20Want%20for%20Christmas%20Is%20You%20%28Mariah%20Carey%20song%29">All I Want for Christmas Is You</a>" and, three days after <a href="Whitney%20Houston">Whitney Houston's</a> death, performed a tribute version of "<a href="I%20Will%20Always%20Love%20You">I Will Always Love You</a>". She also played Dr. Frank-N-Furter in the episode "<a href="The%20Rocky%20Horror%20Glee%20Show">The Rocky Horror Glee Show</a>", singing the lead on the song "<a href="Sweet%20Transvestite">Sweet Transvestite</a>" to generally positive reviews from critics. For her role as Mercedes Jones, Riley won a <a href="Screen%20Actors%20Guild%20Award">Screen Actors Guild Award</a> and received nominations for three <a href="NAACP%20Image%20Award">NAACP Image Award</a>s and three <a href="Teen%20Choice%20Awards">Teen Choice Awards</a>.
Riley appeared at the <a href="2010%20MTV%20Video%20Music%20Awards">2010 MTV Video Music Awards</a> and later sang the national anthem at the <a href="2012%20Democratic%20National%20Convention">2012 Democratic National Convention</a>. She also co-wrote a track titled "Leave a Light On" for British group <a href="The%20Saturdays">The Saturdays</a>, which is featured on their album "<a href="Living%20for%20the%20Weekend%20%28The%20Saturdays%20album%29">Living for the Weekend</a>". In January 2014, Riley and her sister Ashley launched a <a href="Plus-size%20clothing">plus size</a> online clothing boutique, Rileyland Fashions. She also models the garments. Riley's debut single, "Colorblind", premiered live on April 3, 2014, on "<a href="The%20Queen%20Latifah%20Show">The Queen Latifah Show</a>". The song was written by <a href="Emeli%20Sand%C3%A9">Emeli Sandé</a>, <a href="Claude%20Kelly">Claude Kelly</a> and <a href="Steve%20Mac">Steve Mac</a>, and was released as a digital download on April 8, 2014. It was expected to be the lead single off her debut album. The song was also performed by Riley on "Glee". In 2015, it was reported that Riley would star in a Christmas television film, her first movie role, and her first acting role, since "Glee". In December 2015, she portrayed Addaperle, the Good Witch of the North, in <a href="The%20Wiz%20Live%21">NBC's live performance</a> of "<a href="The%20Wiz">The Wiz</a>". In February 2016, it was announced that Riley would portray the lead role of Effie White in "<a href="Dreamgirls">Dreamgirls</a>", at the <a href="Savoy%20Theatre">Savoy Theatre</a> in London's <a href="West%20End%20theatre">West End</a>, beginning performances in November 2016. Riley recorded a number of tracks for <a href="Todrick%20Hall">Todrick Hall</a>'s visual album "<a href="Straight%20Outta%20Oz%20%28album%29">Straight Outta Oz</a>". Also in 2016 she performed the national anthem at the second game of the <a href="2016%20NHL%20Stadium%20Series">2016 NHL Stadium Series</a> featuring the <a href="Detroit%20Red%20Wings">Detroit Red Wings</a> and <a href="Colorado%20Avalanche">Colorado Avalanche</a> at <a href="Coors%20Field">Coors Field</a>.
In 2017, Riley teamed up with British singers <a href="Beverley%20Knight">Beverley Knight</a> and <a href="Cassidy%20Janson">Cassidy Janson</a> to form a musical theatre <a href="Musical%20supergroup">supergroup</a>, known collectively as the Leading Ladies. Their debut album, "Songs from the Stage", was released on November 17, 2017 and features covers songs from "<a href="Cats%20%28musical%29">Cats</a>", "" and "<a href="Rent%20%28musical%29">Rent</a>" among others.
In 2019, she took on the role of Audrey II, the carnivorous singing plant, in "<a href="Little%20Shop%20of%20Horrors%20%28musical%29">Little Shop of Horrors</a>" at <a href="Pasadena%20Playhouse">Pasadena Playhouse</a>.
"Dancing with the Stars".
In 2013, Riley won the <a href="Dancing%20with%20the%20Stars%20%28U.S.%20season%2017%29">seventeenth season</a> of <a href="American%20Broadcasting%20Company">ABC</a>'s dancing competition "<a href="Dancing%20with%20the%20Stars%20%28U.S.%20TV%20series%29">Dancing with the Stars</a>". She was partnered with the show's one and only six-time champion, <a href="Derek%20Hough">Derek Hough</a>. Riley and Hough tied the record for highest first-week score of 27, received 5 perfect scores of 30, and only received a score lower than 8 one time. Riley is the first African-American woman to win "Dancing With the Stars".
2020: "RILEY".
On February 28, 2020 Riley confirmed she finished recording songs for her debut extended play. Following her "<a href="Jimmy%20Kimmel%20Live%21">Jimmy Kimmel Live!</a>" performance on August 28 it was announced her EP would be released on October 2. She later confirmed she would be performing under the name "Riley" (stylized in <a href="all%20caps">all caps</a> as "RILEY") and released the single "A Moment" on September 4. "BGE" (<a href="initialism">initialism</a> for "big girl energy") was released as the second single from the EP on September 18, alongside its music video. The EP was released on October 2, 2020, featuring a total of six tracks. On October 8, 2020 she released a music video for the track "Creepin'".
